Issue_Title: Depth of knowledge of a particular stage in the roadmap
Issue_Body: ### Feature Description  It would be very helpful to know how much of a particular stage a learner needs to know at a particular stage for them to proceed to the next stage without going down the spiral of tutorial hell and spending too much time learning things that are not important or can be as clear at that particular stage of the learning. I am using your roadmaps but quite often, I find myself learning too much of things which I forget later on since they weren't as important at that particular stage and need to relearn everything from the beginning when the time comes for them. Like for example I was learning Pandas in a particular roadmap and I learning many different functions that are useful but I didn't use many of them apart from a 2-3 I can easily name and remember and the rest I forgot. Then whenever I need to use any of the other functions, I have to go through all the documentation and use cases all over again to understand how they are used to make sense and all that previous time I spent learning them feels wasted since they were not required at that earlier stage.

Issue_Title: Unity WebGL game running in Flutter WebView unable to connect to game server
Issue_Body: **Question:**  I'm facing an issue with a Unity WebGL game hosted within a Flutter WebView, where the game is unable to establish a connection to the game server. Here are the details:  **Problem:**  - I have a Unity WebGL game running within a WebView in a Flutter app. - The Unity game needs to connect to a game server to fetch game data and resources. - However, when the Unity game attempts to connect to the game server, it fails to establish a connection.  **Observations:**  - I've monitored network traffic using Wireshark and observed that when the Flutter app runs the Unity WebGL game in the WebView, the game does not appear to make any outbound connections to the internet. - The game server is accessible and functional, as confirmed by other clients connecting successfully. - The Flutter app has opened a socket and is receiving game requirements via Socket.IO. These requirements include the URL of the game server. - The Unity game within the WebView should receive the game server URL from the Flutter app and use it to establish a connection to the server.  **Questions:**  - Has anyone encountered similar issues with Unity WebGL games hosted within Flutter WebViews failing to connect to game servers? - Are there any known limitations or configuration settings in Flutter WebViews that could prevent outbound network connections from Unity WebGL content? - Are there any recommended approaches or best practices for enabling Unity WebGL games within Flutter apps to establish connections to external game servers? - Any insights or suggestions on how to troubleshoot or resolve this issue would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you for your assistance!
Author: Jalili-73

Issue_Title: [DynamicHead - Microsoft] Implementation request
Issue_Body: ### Model description  Hi there!  I was wondering if anyone has tried to implement Microsoft's DyHead? If not, I would like to contribute the implementation by adding a new model to the library. Is there any interest in a PR for this model?  Here a short explanation from their official implementation: _"In this paper, we present a novel dynamic head framework to unify object detection heads with attentions. By coherently combining multiple self-attention mechanisms between feature levels for scale-awareness, among spatial locations for spatial-awareness, and within output channels for task-awareness, the proposed approach significantly improves the representation ability of object detection heads without any computational overhead."_  ### Open source status  - [X] The model implementation is available - [X] The model weights are available  ### Provide useful links for the implementation  GitHub Repository: [Link](https://github.com/microsoft/DynamicHead/tree/master) Paper: [Link](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2106.08322.pdf)
Author: lsch0lz

Issue_Title: Moving and resizing window with modifier key and mouse
Issue_Body: ### Description of the new feature / enhancement  When pressing alt and left-clicking within a window, the window can be moved. When pressing alt and right-clicking near a corner of a window, the window is resized from that corner outwards.  For both, the standard window movement and resizing functionality is activated. When combined with the shortcut defined for FancyZones, the FancyZones functionality can be activated easily without having to select the titlebar.  ### Scenario when this would be used?  It makes it very efficient and easy to quickly manage windows on different large screens, as most power users are probably using in their day-to-day workflow.  It also makes it a lot easier to move a window seeing how the title bar space reserved for moving a window differs a lot between applications. - OneNote has a very big zone in the title bar - Browsers such as Edge usually have a very small zone when there are a lot of tabs open  ### Supporting information  This is the functionality provided by external utilities such as - https://stefansundin.github.io/altdrag/ - https://github.com/RamonUnch/AltSnap/releases
Author: abhowitzer

Issue_Title: [docs] need for a blog about how to optimize MUI
Issue_Body: ### Related page  https://mui.com/material-ui/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/  ### Kind of issue  Missing information  ### Issue description  I think we definitely need some blog posts about how to make your SPA app faster when using MUI. I also experienced MUI performance hits in my ReactJS app and did not know what should I do except looking for a needle in a haystack. It was a real pain in the neck.  So now I think you have a very good understanding of what might goes wrong when using MUI and just jot them down in a blog post so that people like me have a place to look for possible explanation. Also it will help us to understand what we are doing that is wrong and needs to be changed.  ### Context  Having a better understanding on how to use MUI in a performant fashion without feeling overwhelmed and possibly not ending up saying "I cut my losses!" or "I decided it was not worth it!". I already feel that so many devs are in my shoes and just wanted to voice it.  I also do not see making my own custom components using a css lib like tailwind as a viable and feasible answer since I really do not wanna spent hours and hours to create, maintain, write tests, debug, take care of accessibility issues on my own :sweat_smile:.  Please share your thought with me and if your think I am missing something please point it out.  Thanks for the wonderful MUI and this lovely support.  **Search keywords**: optimization, performance, MUI, material UI
Author: kasir-barati

Issue_Title: Fibaro FGBHMS-001 Homekit Bluetooth Motion Sensor reports with huge delay
Issue_Body: ### The problem  The Fibaro FGBHMS-001 is the Bluetooth version of the Fibaro FGMS-001 ZWave PIR. It is meant to be directly connected to a homepod or iDevice.  Although it can be easily connected to the Homekit controller integration, once connected, it either has an enormous delay in reporting events or it becomes stuck on a random event it has reported (it has reported motion for an entire day or more and only recovered when I reloaded the integration). However, it never becomes unresponsive.  Its built in LED always reacts to detection events as it should, indicating that the device is making correct detections.  The device is located about 3 meters away, line of sight, from the RPi 4. I have also placed a Bluetooth proxy beacon about a meter away and the issue is not improved, even though it reports a signal strength of between -50 to -60 db. A replacement Shelly Motion BLU, placed in the same location, works perfectly.  ### What version of Home Assistant Core has the issue?  core-2024.4.3  ### What was the last working version of Home Assistant Core?  _No response_  ### What type of installation are you running? Issue_Title: [feat]: swap fixed height for a p-[10px] tag in Input component
Issue_Body: ### Feature description  My suggestion is to use a fixed padding over fixed height for an input component because a fixed padding allows the input component to adapt better to different screen sizes and device orientations. In contrast, fixed height can lead to inconsistency in appearance, especially on devices with varying screen dimensions and padding creates breathing space around the input field, enhancing the overall visual appeal and readability. It prevents the input field from appearing cramped, which can happen when using fixed height, especially if the content length varies. In summary, opting for fixed padding (such as a p-[10px]) in an input component contribute to a more user-friendly and visually pleasing interface overall.  ### Affected component/components  Input  ### Additional Context  I spent several minutes debugging my style tree before thinking of checking the auto generated source, my bad.  ### Before submitting  - [X] I've made research efforts and searched the documentation - [X] I've searched for existing issues and PRs

Issue_Title: Only when streaming with AV1-SVT encoder to Youtube, the stream does not restore it self if frames have dropped. other encoders do restore the stream when connection stabilizes
Issue_Body: ### Operating System Info  Windows 10  ### Other OS  _No response_  ### OBS Studio Version  30.1.2  ### OBS Studio Version (Other)  _No response_  ### OBS Studio Log URL  https://obsproject.com/logs/0E2OEckpOnAee6kh  ### OBS Studio Crash Log URL  _No response_  ### Expected Behavior  OBS with AV1-SVT encoder selected should continue the stream to YouTube after frames dropped. and connection has stabilized.  ### Current Behavior  Only when using the new AV1-SVT this happen, if for example you are streaming, and you upload a big file, saturating your upload speed, the stream naturally will drop frames, but after you stop uploading the big file. the stream will keep permanently dropping frames forever. even though the internet is very stable. I thoroughly tested this with all other encoders except AV1-AOM. they all restore the stream once connection is stabilized ![OBS](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/assets/23524925/39f77667-5faa-4a4e-a697-3176cd3868ef)   ### Steps to Reproduce  1.Stream to YouTube with AV1-SVT 2.reproduce by getting it to dropframes: I can do it by saturating my upload speed. like uploading a big file 3.Stop the thing that causes it to dropframes. it will not restore the stream and it will keep dropping frames ...   ### Anything else we should know?  I seen many others on reddit they have this exact issue. I tried the other Youtube servers same issue, but this issue does not exist when using other encoders like x264, NVENC, H264

Author: DavidHJong

Issue_Title: My big wish: a blogging functionality and a frontend
Issue_Body: I'm sure you might be thinking _"haven't you heard of Wordpress!?"_ and I can imagine that you want to stay focused on what you do so well, but let me just chip in with what I think would bring crazy additional value to Metabase however it could be achieved: a built-in blogging functionality and a little frontend scaffolding to make it truly a self-contained data universe.  **Describe the solution you'd like**  I can see this sitting very naturally alongside the dashboard functionality and being very valuable when data teams are presenting internally or (in my use case, and I think this can be done well) when sharing some of the data that's behind authentication (in the "Metaverse if you will!") externally. Taking the data storytelling that Metabase does so well and putting a few words around it.  The "website builder" could be simply a static homepage generator which would automatically display for non-authenticated users (ie, the world at large) while those who are registered or want to register are directed towards a login. An obvious "nice to have" here would be the ability to embed any dashboard or embeddable object that's been created on the backend.  For example, an easy homepage template might be "our last ten dashboards" (filtering on those that are configured for public access).  **Describe alternatives you've considered**  The public dashboards are great but my mind turns to "how can I take these standalone resources and bring them into something that connects the dots?" And then I think about integrating all these visuals into a CMS. That's fine but I wonder if a frontend could do this.  **How important is this feature to you?**  I'm an open-source user attempting a very experimentary implementation for the purpose of creating an open access shared dataset visualisation library (sorry, that was a bit of a mouthful). In this use-case that's more storytelling than business data analysis quite important. For others, probably a lot less so.  **Additional context**  None. Enjoy Metabase a lot and think it's rather in unique in making data fun and friendly. The creative part of my brain naturally jumps to what other storytelling elements could be layered in!
Author: danielrosehill

Issue_Title: Notify a user that another user is editing the question in real time to avoid conflicts
Issue_Body: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**  Yes, this feature request addresses the issue of concurrent editing conflicts. Currently, when multiple users edit the same query or dashboard simultaneously, confusion can arise. The first editor might be unaware of changes made by a second editor, potentially leading to overwritten edits. This can be frustrating for both users and hinder collaboration.  **Describe the solution you'd like**  I have two solution for it: - **Real-time editing notifications:** (Acknowledging complexity) Ideally, Metabase could display a message when a user opens a question for editing, indicating if another user is currently modifying it. This approach requires active monitoring of editor activity and might be more complex to implement. - **"Save" button revision notice:** A potentially simpler solution would be to leverage the existing revisions feature. Upon clicking "Save," Metabase could display a notification if a new revision has been created since the user initially opened the resource for editing. This would alert the user to potential conflicts before saving their changes.  **Describe alternatives you've considered**  We haven't identified any effective workarounds within the current Metabase functionality. Manually checking for edits or relying solely on communication between users is not ideal and can hinder smooth collaboration.  **How important is this feature to you?**  This feature improves the user experience when teams are using Metabase collaboratively. It minimizes confusion, wasted effort caused by conflicting edits, and fosters a more productive collaborative environment.     Proposal for Notice on Save modal: ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/15375579/79ef9357-7c00-4501-90fc-1adcf0081d82)   Note: Edited by Gemini
Author: mrp97

Issue_Title: Origin HTML/XML becomes overwritten if a translation is created in EN(US)
Issue_Body: Impacted versions: 16 & 17  Steps to reproduce:  Scenario: Default language DE, additional languages FR, NL, EN etc. installed.  In Website Editor start to create a page in DE. HTML/XML is created correctly in DE with all codes, scripts, tags etc. You are able to edit HTML/XML in Editor and all is going fine. After you are satisfied with your page, in next step you create the translations in any language you want, all is going fine... The HTML/XML is still the origin that you've created. Now in final step you perhaps want to create the translation for EN(US), do it and your developed HTML/XML becomes directly overwritten by a variant from the EN(US) translation. From now on all is going wrong, the translations become unstable/unlogical/inconsistant, changes in HTML/XML will directly affect all other translations up to trace backs from Odoo.  To check this behaviour it is enough to create only a head-line with a test text in Website-Editor, no need to create a full page...  Also if you just (want to) change some little code in your default language all translations become affected, still if there were previous translations stored.  The affect does not appear if you decide to translate to EN(UK,CA...)  This remembers me to https://github.com/odoo/odoo/issues/124124 and https://github.com/odoo/odoo/issues/150829  Perhaps it's only a small workout to correct, otherwise we're building on sand... This behaviour i recognized after a client decided to expand his (non-english) web-site from one to some more different languages. Therefore - Be aware - Please don't try this in your production or own development environment, use RunBot or a blank database and you're save ;-)   Current behavior: overwriting origin HTML/XML after translation to en_US  Expected behavior: NOT overwriting origin HTML/XML after translation to en_US
Author: rk-aix

Issue_Title: HttpClient doesn't have authentication headers during OnInitialized or OnAfterRender when using global InteractiveAuto rendering
Issue_Body: ### Is there an existing issue for this?  - [x] I have searched the existing issues  ### Describe the bug  The issue arises when using global interactive rendering and attempting to fetch data from an authorized endpoint during OnInitializedAsync or OnAfterRenderAsync events. In this scenario, the request gets redirected to the login page instead of the intended endpoint.  ### Expected Behavior  The request is sent to the right destination. The issue might be that the HttpClient lacks authorization headers during the initial server-side render when the server controls the request. This could be resolved by automatically passing the headers from the initial get request.  ### Steps To Reproduce  I've uploaded a repository [repo](https://github.com/AgenChicken24/Blazor-8-Bug)  demonstrating the issue. Apply the database migrations, then log in and try manually entering the endpoints "/data" to retrieve data and "/upload" to add data to the database. You can then go to the page called "Bug" and an error should occur.  Workaround 1: Change the global render mode from InteractiveAuto to InteractiveWebAssembly ![workaround](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/assets/64702468/09305ec9-5255-45f5-81cf-45e33f97cb01)  Workaround 2 (untested): Avoid using InteractiveAuto globally and set that page to render in "InteractiveWebAssembly" mode. Request the data on the initial render.  ### Exceptions (if any)  _No response_  ### .NET Version  8.204  ### Anything else?  _No response_

Issue_Title: Module docs don't appear in monolithic docs.rs page
Issue_Body: Every bevy crate has it's own docs.rs page, and also appears as modules within [the monolithic bevy documentation page](https://docs.rs/bevy/latest/bevy/). Users are usually directed to the monolithic docs, and it's what we link to on the website.  Unfortunately module level docs (like [this](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blame/13cac2eeff7e3c4da7ae636ba3766f59b4e343d0/crates/bevy_reflect/src/lib.rs#L9)) don't display properly on the monolithic module page ([here](https://docs.rs/bevy/latest/bevy/reflect/index.html) for example). They do render properly on the individual crate docs ([this](https://docs.rs/bevy_reflect/latest/bevy_reflect/) is how the rendered docs should look). This means most users are loosing out on important structural documentation.
Author: NthTensor

Issue_Title: Mutable Animation Clips
Issue_Body: Hello,   I am trying to write a skeletal animation edition tool using bevy. However, the animation clips used by bevy are read only.  I understand that this is probably due to the fact that animation assets are tied to their loading files and the logic of having code modifying it can seem weird. However for a game editor I believe it would still make sense to have tools that allow animation edition within bevy ?   Would it be possible to have mutable access to VariableCurves or expose functions that would allow the modification of animation asset inside bevy ?   My goal is then to export this animation into a brand new animation file.   For now the only solution I can think of is to fork bevy and force this mutable animation setup OR make a new animation plugin which would consist of a lot of duplicated code. Another way would be to create a brand new AnimationClip everytime I make an edit using the only mutable function exposed by AnimationClip (add_curve_to_target) but this would kill my performance...   I'm failry new to Rust and Bevy so bare with me if there are obvious solutions.  Thanks !
Author: nzhao95

Issue_Title: [Feature Request] Automatic pause function and detailed settings
Issue_Body: ### Overview  I would like the emulation to run only when Ryujinx is active and to have the ability to automatically pause when it is not active.  ### Smaller details  - Pause everything when Ryujinx is not active This is useful if you want to stop time passing in the game, but it's hard to use if you want to keep it passing.  - Mute audio when Ryujinx is not active  Use when you don't want to stop Ryujinx but the background music is in the way.  - Prevents input when Ryujinx is not active.  Prevent controller input from entering Ryujinx side while working on other games or emus.  Many applications will not accept input unless the game screen is active, but Ryujinx does not, so we feel this setting is necessary.  ### Nature of request  It's inconvenient to use Ryujinx while interacting with other games and apps.  ### Why would this feature be useful?  When Ryujinx is in use and is no longer the active window due to other work being performed, you can choose to play/stop background music, progress/stop games, and enable/disable input from the controller. Automatically pausing or partially limiting these functions when they are not needed can reduce computer load and power consumption. Even if you switch windows frequently, you will not have to worry about pausing and unpausing Ryujinx.

Issue_Title: OPTIONS HTTP method body processing
Issue_Body: ### Prerequisites  - [X] I have written a descriptive issue title - [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure the issue has not already been raised   ### Issue  Should we be processing the body of OPTIONS requests?  [MDN says they cannot have a body](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods/OPTIONS), and I couldn't find it in the RFC  That would mean placing OPTIONS next to GET and HEAD here:  https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/7942e38d78f9d98d92c17460681d7d42a278e7bd/lib/handleRequest.js#L23-L59

See the source, we're basically just using ZodType:  - https://github.com/t3-oss/t3-env/blob/main/packages/core/src/index.ts - https://github.com/t3-oss/t3-env/blob/main/packages/nextjs/src/index.ts  We're also not really using the ZodType generics, so I don't think that change is relevant here. We're only using ZodType as a constraint

Issue_Title: Enable/Disable Screen Recordings Upon Sound Alerts Feature
Issue_Body: Could this feature be implemented?  Have ShareX trigger random lengths recordings at random times based upon specific audio signals.  For example, when the PC plays the "Switch On" audio signal, ShareX starts a recording.  Then after some random time interval elapses, the computer plays the "Switch Off"  audio signal and ShareX stops the recording.   ShareX would simply "listen all day long to" the computer for the said audio signals, and auto start and stop recordings (for example for a 10 hours period,  ShareX would record at random times between 10 and 200 clips based on  the audio alerts it hears from the computer).  I looked at this [Reddit ](https://www.reddit.com/r/pcmasterrace/comments/7txf1q/how_to_have_a_macro_triggered_by_a_sound_effect/) related AHK macro suggestion but I'm not sure how this could work with ShareX.
Author: fixck

Issue_Title: Please make it simple!
Issue_Body: ### Outline & Motivation  One thing tensorflow falls behind pytorch is its too complex designs, while pytorch is much simpler. But when I start to use pytorch-lightning, I feel that it is another tensorflow. So I beg your guys make thing simple. For a simple saving checkpoint function, I search the code from ModelCheckpoint, to trainer.save_checkpoint, and then checkpoint_connector.save_checkpoint, and then trainer.strategy.save_checkpoint, where is the end? How to ensure correctness under such complex designs? Please make it simple!  ### Pitch  The strategy design in tensorflow is too complex, DDP is just a simple all reduce of gradients. But in strategy or keras, things become very complex, the function call stacks are very deep that we could hard understand where is it doing the actual all reduce? Even the users spend weeks of time, they may not figure out what you are actually doing because there is call from module a to b, then to c, then to a, then to b, then I give up.  ### Additional context I suggest to implement things as what it is, stop over encapsulation, please follow the design patterns of pytorch and caffe, stop making simple functions complicated.  cc @justusschock @awaelchli
Author: chengmengli06

Issue_Title: [reopen] [proposal] auto polyfilling support via @babel/preset-env
Issue_Body: ### Command  build, serve  ---  I completely disagree with the fact that feature requests are closed without an exhaustive explanation. This is actually the scope of angular-cli. So, reopen: #17318   ---  ### Description  According to [Official Document](https://angular.io/guide/browser-support#polyfills), polyfills can only be included manually.  Sometimes we somehow use ESNext features like Array.prototype.flatMap but forget adding its polyfill into polyfills.ts, it accidentally breaks on some browsers.  ### Describe the solution you'd like  In https://github.com/alauda, we are using [@alauda/custom-webpack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alauda/custom-webpack) which pipes babel-loader after @ngtools/webpack in webpack config, so that we get auto polyfilling successfully via @babel/preset-env.  So I'm suggesting to add auto polyfilling support into @angular/cli.  ### Describe alternatives you've considered  If we can build all .ts via @ngtools/webpack with targeting esnext, then we can use babel to compiling all ES syntaxes totally but are able to get types metadata still at the same time.
Author: MillerSvt

Issue_Title: Table Component: Negative values are not sorting in column properly
Issue_Body: ### What is the expected behaviour? When sorting a column of negative numbers in ascending order within a table component, the numbers should correctly display in ascending order. For example, given the values -2, -1, and -3, the sorted order should be -3, -2, -1.  ### What is the current behaviour? Currently, the sorting functionality does not handle negative numbers correctly. When attempting to sort a column containing the values -2, -1, and -3 in ascending order, the output is incorrectly displayed as -1, -2, -3.

Issue_Title: Unnecessary auto-saves for minor canvas interactions -App builder
Issue_Body: ### Current Behavior: The canvas auto-saves every time there is a change, including minor interactions like button clicks. This triggers unnecessary API calls.  ### Expected Behavior: The canvas should only auto-save for significant "Actions" that modify the canvas content (e.g., adding/removing components, changing properties/styles). Minor interactions, such as button clicks, should not trigger auto-saves.  **Note: This will be fixed in Grid PR**  **Future Suggestion:** 1. Introducing changes history with timeline

Issue_Title: ServiceLB back after auto-upgrade; k3s seems to ignore parameters from systemd unit after upgrade
Issue_Body: **Environmental Info:** K3s Version: 1.27.7, 1.28.5, 1.29.3, applies to all of these  Node(s) CPU architecture, OS, and Version:  Debian 11, Debian 12, AMD64  Cluster Configuration: 3 servers, 3 agents  **Describe the bug:** When running K3s auto-upgrade service on the server nodes, suddenly K3s starts with ServiceLB enabled despite it being disabled in the systemd unit. I'm certain this has to do with how the auto upgrade job restarts the k3s binary, ignoring parameters set in the systemd unit.  **Steps To Reproduce:** 1. Run K3s with some custom parameters like disabling serviceLB or stuff like that from a systemd unit 2. Install and configure auto upgrade service according to https://docs.k3s.io/upgrades/automated 3. see that the newly started K3s ignores the parameters set in the systemd unit  **Expected behavior:** After the upgrade the parameters configured in the systemd unit should still be applied  **Actual behavior:** I can at least see serviceLB pods being created where none have been before (disabled in favor of MetalLB)
Author: HWiese1980

Issue_Title: Make individual app boot methods more lazy
Issue_Body: While looking at some flamegraphs I noticed that we still have plenty of apps that have logic in the boot method that could be done far more lazy. Those would trigger larger chunks of dependency injection pulling in class instances that might not be needed (yet). While some dependencies might still be pulled in later there is definitiely potential for saving some load in the app boot process.  While every change itself might be rather small, this could add up in total to become a nice improvement.  A few examples that could be beneficial to move: - [ ] Mount provider registration (files_sharing, files_external, groupfolders, collectives, ...) - [ ] Some apps like files_sharing still register events in a non-lazy way - [ ] dav app hook manager pulls in lots of dependencies (https://github.com/nextcloud/server/blob/443b26761ddb80e8724b4eab1076f349cf62f6fd/apps/dav/lib/AppInfo/Application.php#L222) - [ ] Legacy resource provider (deck/talk) is not done fully lazy - [ ] Share provider registration requires to setup the ShareManager (currently only relevant for deck as talk is hard coded in server) - [ ] Comments event handler registration requires to pull in ICommentsManager https://github.com/nextcloud/server/blob/aa5f037af71c915424c6dcfd5ad2dc82797dc0d6/apps/comments/lib/AppInfo/Application.php#L86 - [ ] Legacy ISearch provider registration (could be dropped) - [ ] files_lock registering lock provider (while ILockManager is free of dependencies, LockProvider has quite some that might be not needed on every request)   - [ ] https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/44953   - [ ] https://github.com/nextcloud/files_lock/pull/297 - [ ] Register template creators (text/richdocuments/onlyoffice)   - [ ] https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/44952  ![xdebug _ocs_v2_php_apps_notifications_api_v2_notifications 1713767602 182289 xt gz](https://github.com/nextcloud/server/assets/3404133/0c0774de-7b5e-41fc-b716-b9c630922f4d)
Author: juliushaertl

Issue_Title: Smart Closing & Smart Shutdown / Restart seeding option
Issue_Body: ### Suggestion  **Smart Closing:** When this option is ticked, closing qBittorrent will stop accepting new seeding queues, eventually close when all uploads are finished. **Smart Shutdown / Restart:** Above feature with capability to shut down or reboot the operating system, only accessible with a right-click context menu, or Tools(T) in toolbar.  ### Use case  When user installs a system update that requires a restart, and they can wait a bit, this feature will provide a more graceful program termination for the downloading end. (In my case I am the only seeder for a bunch of torrents simply because these are like 20 years old files).  Improving seeding on standard PC, which would save average user's cost on investing for a NAS or server, which increases the likelihood for them to donate. Consider this is valuable enough to be a premium add-on.
Author: iAvoe

Issue_Title: [Bug]: MessageTokenLimiter ignored for output of Tools
Issue_Body: ### Describe the bug  MessageTokenLimiter works as expected for output not generated by Tools. However, when Tools are used, this appears not to be the case.  ### Steps to reproduce  - Create a custom tool that generates a large amount of data (in my case, the output of a swagger.json file) - Interact with the tool using a ConversableAgent that has a MessageTokenLimiter configured   ### Model Used  gpt-3.5-turbo  ### Expected Behavior  The truncated output should be sent to the GPT model, not the entire output, which triggers a rate limit  ### Screenshots and logs  In the screenshots, I show that even though the print statement mentions that the tokens were limited, it appears that the non-truncated output is sent to the GPT mode.  Output shows that the output of my tool is correctly being truncated ![image](https://github.com/microsoft/autogen/assets/2312803/ac9fa5fe-c5a6-46d0-87ac-89073292e1c0)  This seems to be ignored when calling the LLM though, showing a rate limit ![image](https://github.com/microsoft/autogen/assets/2312803/76e7a593-6dfa-4407-a832-c0c81f051d1b)   ### Additional Information  _No response_

Issue_Title: User Directory not created on Signup / access to root folder
Issue_Body: When the function "Auto create user home dir while adding new user" is enabled in Global, the autocreate user directory works only if the account is created from Admin user management. If we allow "Allow users to signup" then during signup, the user home dir is set to / giving him access to all the folders.  Can the signup use the same function as creating user from admin, this will resolve the issue.  If anyone has manage to solve this otherwise please let me know
Author: bavesh

Issue_Title: Filebrowser docker container in unhealthy status
Issue_Body: **Description** My FileBrowser Docker container works like a charm. But for several weeks already, the unhealthy flag is active but I don't neither see any error message in the docker logs, nor any misbehaviour.  **Expected behaviour** Healthy docker container status flag  **What is happening instead?** Unhealthy docker container status flag  **Additional context** n/A  **How to reproduce?** Directly after deployment and start  **Files** ![log](https://github.com/filebrowser/filebrowser/assets/15525250/956c11a8-6a93-438f-bfe2-991bdb3e945d)

Issue_Title: [BUG] If you copy a large amount of html/Js/ejs into the chat, it affects the interface.
Issue_Body: **Describe the bug** If you copy a large amount of html/Js/ejs into the chat, it leaks to the interface.  **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior:  1. Open a flow 2. Start a chat by copy and paste the content of my (GPT-Pilot) project summery file to the chat 3. click "send" 4. See the background color turn from black to white (dark mode)  **Expected behavior** No impact what ever you send  **Setup**  -   Installation pnpm start -   Flowise Version 1.6.5 -   OS: Debian 12 -   Browser: Firefox 125.0.1  [project_summary.txt](https://github.com/FlowiseAI/Flowise/files/15057201/project_summary.txt)
Author: BadlyDrawnBoy

Issue_Title: Evaluate moving away from grpc.DialContext
Issue_Body: grpc.DialContext has been [deprecated](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/pull/7029) and then [undepricated](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/pull/7103), but will deprecated again in v1.64   We should evaluate moving to NewClient this also might fix other problems
Author: mstoykov
